doc.field: Photographs of the house at 135 Joralemon Street in Brooklyn Heights
Photographs of the house at 135 Joralemon Street in Brooklyn Heights

The Photographs of the house at 135 Joralemon Street in Brooklyn Heights consist of six black-and-white photographic prints showing exterior views of the wooden-frame Federal-style house located in the Brooklyn Heights neighborhood. The photographs focus on the front porch of the house and its decorative cast-iron grillwork that dates from the mid-19th century.

The Photographs of the house at 135 Joralemon Street in Brooklyn Heights consist of six black-and-white photographic prints showing exterior views of the wooden-frame Federal-style house located in the Brooklyn Heights neighborhood. The photographs focus on the front porch of the house and its decorative cast-iron grillwork that dates from the mid-19th century.

The Photographs of the house at 135 Joralemon Street in Brooklyn Heights consist of six black-and-white photographic prints showing exterior views of the wooden-frame Federal-style house located in the Brooklyn Heights neighborhood. The photographs focus on the front porch of the house and its decorative cast-iron grillwork that dates from the mid-19th century.

The two-story-plus-attic Federal-style wooden clapboard house located a 135 Joralemon Street in Brooklyn Heights was built on or before 1833. In the mid-19th century, ornamental cast iron was added to the front porch of the house. As of 2011, this house is one of the few remaining wooden houses in Brooklyn.
